contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=July 2013}} '''Yann Fouéré''' (26 July 1910 – 20 October 2011) was a [[Breton people|Breton]] [[nationalism|nationalist]] and a European federalist.<ref>''Towards a federal Europe''</ref> His French birth certificate names him as ''Jean Adolphe Fouéré'' (French name, as the French State at the time did not allow Breton names). He was born in [[Aignan, Gers]].<ref>[http://www.agencebretagnepresse.com/fetch.php?id=23542 Agence Bretagne Presse]</ref> and died in St.Brieuc, Brittany. He fled France after the French liberation in 1945 and took Irish citizenship in the early 1950s. One of the founders of the [[Celtic League (political organisation)|Celtic League]] along with his compatriot [[Alan Heusaff]], he lived to be 101 years old.<ref>[http://notices.irishtimes.com/12075331 Irish Times Death Notice]</ref> Fouéré was alleged to have been a collaborator during WW2, but was fully exonerated in 1955 following his voluntary return to France to face trial.<ref>[http://www.fondationyannfouere.org/wp-content/uploads/2008/04/004.jpg Fouéré court papers]</ref> ==Family== His daughter is Irish actress [[Olwen Fouéré]]. ==Bibliography== {{ISBN|date=May 2012}} English * ''Towards a federal Europe'', 1968; ISBN 0-7154-0485-7 French * ''L'Europe aux Cent Drapeaux'', 1968 <!-- date?, ISBN#? --> * ''La Bretagne Ecartelée'', Nouvelles éditions latines, 1962 <!-- date?, ISBN#? --> * ''Problèmes Bretons du Temps Présent'' <!-- date?, ISBN#? --> * "En prison pour la libération de la Bretagne".
